description: Late Middle English, from Medieval Latin asafoetida, from Persian ازا / آزا‎ (azâ, âzâ, “mastic”) + Latin foetida, feminine of foetidus (“bad-smelling”).

entries.meaning: A resinous gum from the stem and roots of Ferula species such as Ferula foetida and Ferula assa-foetida, having a strong, unpleasant smell, with culinary and medical uses. [from 14th c.]
